title: Music & MEmory: A Pragmatic TRial for Nursing Home Residents With ALzheimer's Disease
description_brief: The purpose of this trial is to test the effects of a personalized music intervention (Music and Memory, Inc.) on agitated and aggressive behaviors for nursing home residents with dementia.
description_detailed:
The purpose of this study is to conduct a parallel, pragmatic, cluster randomized control trial of personalized music (Music and Memory) for nursing home residents with moderate to severe dementia living in 54 nursing homes (27 treatment, 27 control) from 4 nursing home corporations. Music and Memory is a personalized music program that uses portable music players to deliver individualized music to people with dementia at times when agitated behaviors are likely.

\*\*This funding mechanism sponsored two parallel trials with different implementation strategies. In this trial, music is preloaded on personalized music devices to increase nursing use of the music with residents. Details of the first parallel trial conducted under this funding mechanism are registered under "R33AG057451\_part1."\*\*

The aims of this study are: 1. To use a train-the-trainer model to implement the intervention with ongoing monitoring of the program's adoption and acceptance by nursing home residents with dementia; 2. To estimate the impact of Music and Memory on agitated and aggressive behaviors; and 3. To examine factors associated with variation in providers' adherence to the implementation of Music and Memory.

groups.title: Usual Care
groups.description: Usual care for managing agitated and/or aggressive behaviors in the nursing home setting

groups.title: Music & Memory
groups.description:
Music and Memory is a personalized music program in which nursing home staff provide people with dementia with music playlists tailored to their personal history of music preferences at early signs of agitation

Music \& Memory: Music and Memory is a personalized music program in which caregivers (nursing home staff, family, or others) provide people with dementia with music playlists tailored to their personal history of music preferences at times when behaviors are likely

outcomeMeasures.title: Frequency of Agitated and Aggressive Behaviors (Staff Report)
outcomeMeasures.description: The tool used to interview staff about resident behaviors is the Cohen-Mansfield Agitation Inventory (CMAI). Research staff interview nursing staff who know the resident well to ask how frequently 29 agitated/aggressive behaviors occurred in the past week. There are seven response choices for each item, anchored from never (1) to several times per hour (7). Total scores on the CMAI range from 29 to 203, with higher scores representing more frequent agitated/aggressive behaviors. The CMAI is administered at baseline and follow-up.

analyses.otherAnalysisDescription:
Fixed effect covariates: age, sex, race, activities of daily living score, cognitive function score, psychotic disorder, bipolar disease, depression, anxiety, dementia, alzheimer's diagnosis, antidepressant use, antianxietal use, antipsychotic use, history of heart failure, baseline ARBS (exclusive to CMAI model), baseline CMAI (exclusive to ARBS model), indicator of baseline/follow-up score, treatment group, interaction of treatment group and baseline/follow-up score.

Random effects: random intercept for nursing home, random intercept for the interaction of baseline/follow-up measure and nursing home, and random intercept for individual.

Imputed Outcomes: 37 Control Follow-Up (Both CMAI and ARBS), 37 Treatment Follow-Up (ABRS), 35 Treatment Follow-Up (CMAI)

outcomeMeasures.title: Frequency of Agitated and Aggressive Behaviors (Administrative Data)
outcomeMeasures.description: The Aggressive Behavior Scale is a 4 item measure describing the frequency of physical behavioral symptoms directed toward others; verbal behavioral symptoms directed toward others; other behavioral symptoms not directed toward others; and behaviors related to resisting necessary care. For each item, frequency in the past week is reported as: behavior not exhibited (0); behavior occurred 1-3 days (1); behavior occurred 4-6 days (2); or behavior occurred daily (3). The Aggressive Behavior Scale ranges from 0 to 12, with higher scores indicating more frequent agitated and/or aggressive behaviors. Mean total scores will be compared for treatment and control populations.

outcomeMeasures.title: Antipsychotic Use
outcomeMeasures.description: Any antipsychotic use in the past week, based on Minimum Data Set (standardized assessment of nursing home residents). Comparison of percent with any use will be compared for treatment and control populations. Measure type of mean is chosen based on adjusted percentage with standard errors from a multilevel, difference in difference regression models.

outcomeMeasures.title: Depression
outcomeMeasures.description: The Patient Health Questionnaire is a 9-item screening assessment for depression severity. For each item, respondents indicate the frequency of the symptom in the past 2 weeks using the following choices: never or one day (0); 2-6 days (1); 7-11 days (2); or 12-14 days (3). Total scores range from 0 to 27, with higher scores indicating more frequent depressive symptoms. Average total scores will be compared for treatment and control populations.

Random effects: random intercept for nursing home, random intercept for the interaction of baseline/follow-up measure and nursing home, and random intercept for individual.

Imputed Outcomes: 37 Control Follow-Up (Both CMAI and ARBS), 37 Treatment Follow-Up (ABRS), 35 Treatment Follow-Up (CMAI)

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: Adverse event data were collected during each resident's 4-month follow-up period.

eventGroups.title: Music & Memory
eventGroups.description:
Music and Memory is a personalized music program in which nursing home staff provide people with dementia with music playlists tailored to their personal history of music preferences at early signs of agitation

Music \& Memory: Music and Memory is a personalized music program in which caregivers (nursing home staff, family, or others) provide people with dementia with music playlists tailored to their personal history of music preferences at times when behaviors are likely

explanation_target: Reason: The intervention is a personalized music program (Music & Memory) delivered to nursing home residents with dementia to reduce agitated and aggressive behaviors — a non‑pharmacological behavioral intervention targeting neuropsychiatric symptoms rather than disease pathology or cognition. citeturn0search6turn0search4

Act (key extracted details): Trial name METRIcAL (Music & MEmory: A Pragmatic TRial for Nursing Home Residents With ALzheimer's Disease). Cluster‑randomized pragmatic trial in 54 nursing homes (27 intervention, 27 control) enrolling 976 residents; intervention = individualized/preferred music delivered via personalized music devices; primary outcomes measured frequency of agitated behaviors (e.g., Cohen‑Mansfield Agitation Inventory) and psychotropic medication use. No drug or placebo is involved. citeturn0search6turn0search0turn0search1

Reflect: Classification justification — This fits the category 'neuropsychiatric symptom improvement' because the stated purpose is to test effects on agitation/aggression (behavioral symptoms). It is neither a biologic nor a small‑molecule disease‑modifying therapy, nor a cognitive enhancer per the trial description and intervention. (Note: trial results reported limited or no significant reduction in overall agitation measures, but this does not change the target category.) citeturn0search0turn0search1

Web search sources consulted (selected): 1) Pragmatic Trial of Personalized Music for Agitation and Antipsychotic Use in Nursing Home Residents With Dementia (PubMed; METRIcAL trial details and outcomes). citeturn0search0 2) Using Structured Observations to Evaluate the Effects of a Personalized Music Intervention on Agitated Behaviors and Mood (study reporting observation results). citeturn0search1 3) Site‑level factors affecting nursing home implementation of a personalized music intervention (qualitative analyses from METRIcAL). citeturn0search2 4) Music & Memory — organization description of the personalized music program. citeturn0search4 5) METRIcAL summary and methods (JAMDA / trial overview). citeturn0search6
explanation_agent: Reason: The METRIcAL / Music & Memory trial tests a personalized music intervention delivered to nursing‑home residents with dementia to reduce agitation and psychotropic medication use. This is a non‑pharmacologic, behavioral intervention that targets neuropsychiatric symptoms (agitation/behavior), not a biological pathway (amyloid, tau, inflammation, synaptic targets, etc.). citeturn0search1turn0search4

Act: Key extracted details — METRIcAL was a pragmatic, cluster‑randomized trial in 54 nursing homes (27 intervention, 27 control) with 976 residents; the intervention was individualized/preferred music delivered via personalized devices; outcomes measured frequency of agitated behaviors (Cohen‑Mansfield Agitation Inventory, structured observations) and psychotropic medication use. No drug, biologic, or molecular target is involved. citeturn0search1turn0search4turn0search6

Reflect: This intervention does not map to any CADRO biological categories (A–Q, S) because it does not act on amyloid, tau, ApoE/lipids, neurotransmitter receptors, inflammation, synaptic plasticity, etc. It is a behavioral/implementation intervention to improve neuropsychiatric symptoms in dementia; per the instructions, such non‑therapeutic or non‑biological interventions should be classified as 'T) Other'. Confirmed by multiple trial reports and implementation/observation papers. citeturn0search2turn0search0

Web search results consulted (selected):
- Pragmatic Trial of Personalized Music for Agitation and Antipsychotic Use in Nursing Home Residents With Dementia (METRIcAL) — trial primary report describing design, outcomes, and that the intervention is individualized music (PubMed). citeturn0search1
- Using Structured Observations to Evaluate the Effects of a Personalized Music Intervention on Agitated Behaviors and Mood — structured observation results from the trial. citeturn0search4
- Resident and Nursing Home Factors Associated With Adherence to a Personalized Music Intervention — post hoc/adherence analysis from METRIcAL. citeturn0search0
- Site‑level factors affecting nursing home implementation of a personalized music intervention — qualitative implementation analysis from METRIcAL. citeturn0search2
- Brown University evaluation summary of Music & Memory describing findings (momentary reductions in some verbal agitation measures). citeturn0search5
